awd_titl_txt: Low Molecular Weight Carbonyls in Seawater: Formation via   Photochemical Processes and Role in the Chemistry of Humic  Substances
awd_abstract_narration: This is a study of low molecular weight carbonyl compounds                 in sea water.  These compounds are important because they are                   involved in many biotic and abiotic processes in the ocean,                     including photochemical transformations in the surface water,                   air-sea exchange, condensation reactions, surface microlayer                    enrichment and microbial transformations.  The research will be                 focused on laboratory investigations designed to facilitate                     interpretation of the project's past field work.  These                         investigations will include experiments on photochemical reaction               pathways, action spectra, reactants, and oxidants.  In these                    experiments low molecular weight carbonyl compounds will be used                as chemical probes.  In addition to this laboratory work, a model               of the carbonyl distribution in the upper mixed layer will be                   developed and tested.
